solution_line_template: After paying the deposit, Danielle still has to pay a total of ${purchase_price}k purchase price - ${deposit}k deposit = $<<{purchase_price}-{deposit}={mortgage_balance}>>{mortgage_balance}k via her mortgage.

As the mortgage is over {mortgage_years} years, Danielle's payments need to total ${mortgage_balance}k mortgage balance / {mortgage_years} years = $<<{mortgage_balance}/{mortgage_years}={annual_payment}>>{annual_payment}k per year.
So each month, Danielle has to pay ${annual_payment}k per year / {months_per_year} months in a year = ${monthly_payment}k per month.
